p: During the extraction of EOs from plants and spices, a large number of by-products is produced, which are discarded although they can still contain a large number of bioactive compounds. As an example, the bioactive compounds from waste solid residues (WSRs) from Salvia sp. after EO extraction were obtained by solvent extraction aided with ultrasound [ 18]. The extraction of polyphenols from waste solid materials from the preparation of essential oils of Lavandula intermedia and Thymus mastichina, among other aromatic plants, demonstrated their antioxidant capacity [ 19]. Therefore, this study aimed to characterize Mexican oregano ( P. longiflora) EO and its by-products and evaluate their antioxidant and antimicrobial activities.
